thread.title: Man Utd transfer news: Napoli president admits Zlatan Ibrahimovic would be his dream signing | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man Utd transfer news: Napoli president admits Zlatan Ibrahimovic would be his dream signing | Metro News

author: Louis Sealey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man Utd transfer news: Napoli president admits Zlatan Ibrahimovic would be his dream signing | Metro News
text:
Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 11:07 pm Zlatan Ibrahimovic has impressed in the Premier League this season (Picture: Getty) 
Napoli president Aurelio De Laurentiis has revealed the extent of his affection for Zlatan Ibrahimovic, admitting the Manchester United striker would be his dream signing. 
The Swedish superstar has impressed under Jose Mourinho this season, scoring 20 goals in 34 appearances for the club. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
Ibrahimovic’s efforts are believed to have earned him a one-year contract extension at Old Trafford, although the 35-year-old has refused to be drawn on his future plans. 
The star’s agent, Mino Raiola, recently admitted his client could be tempted to move to Napoli in the future. 
And the Italian side’s president insists he would love to see the ex-Paris Saint-Germain at San Paolo. Manchester United fixtures 
St-Etienne – Europa (H) Thu 16 Feb Blackburn – FA Cup (A) – Sat 18 Feb St-Etienne – Europa (A) – Wed 22 Feb Southampton – EFL (N) – Sun 26 Feb Bournemouth (H) – Sat 4 Mar Southampton (A) – Sun 12 Mar Middlesbrough (A) – Sun 19 Mar West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr 
‘My dream signing? I always try to go forward with what I have,’ Laurentiis said. Ibrahimovic could sign an extension at United (Picture: Getty) 
‘One that I would like, though, is that giant who is at Manchester United now. I had him as a dinner guest in Los Angeles and he’s incredibly nice, even though he always seems angry. 
‘You know the one I’m talking about, right?’
